data.title: Lots of laughs
data.text: We attended the first act of the evening. Upon entering the venue we were greeted at the door by Jason who made us feel welcome. He gave us a brief tour and told us about the history of the venue. He went out of his way to make us feel welcome. Prices are comparable to other venues and the beverages were good. All three acts were great and kept us laughing all night long. After the show there was time to meet and performers and enjoy some more drinks. We will definitely be back.

data.title: Belly laught my way out of there
data.text: This great city has a lot to offer. Located on commerce street you can attend the comedy club and have a great time. Get on the mailing list and you would win free tickets to attend shows with up to 20 friends. I have seen many great comedians come to that stage and OMG I never had so much fun. There is a 2 drink minimum purchase and they do offer food. the prices are comfortable for any budget.

data.title: Expensive Fun
data.text: Received free tickets and was advised at check in that upgrade would cost five dollars per person in order to guarantee a good seat. Once inside it is mandatory that each person buy at least two items, drinks run about $12. So it was expensive but there was a great comedian and we really enjoyed ourselves. We will go back in the future but we will buy the three dollar bottled water!!

data.title: Fun Time
data.text: My daughters and I enjoyed our night out here recently. We purchased a Groupon for our admission; a really good deal - check into it to save a bunch of money! This is located downstairs, so there are many stairs to navigate OR take the elevator for easy access. There are a couple bar areas to order drinks from if yo are waiting for general admission seating - that's where we sat and could see and hear just fine, but it was cozy - quite a few people in attendance. There is a two-item per person minimum required and the waitress reminded us of that. For one of our items, we chose a basket of chicken strips to share, as we weren't very hungry. The food was good - about $10 for those chicken strips. Several types of drinks from which to choose - including virgin varieties. About $8 each, if I recall. Good entertainment for the price paid using Groupon. Parking was free since it was the weekend; parking garage about 1 1/2 blocks away.

data.title: Good acts, ok venue
data.text: I prefer the comedy club setting versus the large stadium venues a lot of comedians are performing at these days.  That being said, Hyenas would likely never book a Louis ck or Jim gaffigan level comedian but consistently pulls in seasoned classics like Louis Ramey, tom Rhodes, and Greg fitzsimmons.  The size is just right for a true comedy experience.  I was disappointed in their reluctance to bounce rowdy crowds or individuals but they are better at kicking hecklers out than the Dallas venue.  A warning to anyone who signs up and receives "free tickets" - you typically redeem by calling in advance and putting your name in will call, but this does not reserve you anything.  Me and my wife thought we had tickets to a show but were turned away because they were sold old.  Ignore ticket giveaways, always buy your tickets in advance.

data.title: HORRIBLE, CHEATS!
data.text: IF I COULD PUT ZERO STARS, I WOULD!!! THEIR SERVICE SUCKS AND THEY ARE CHEATS!! Our tab with 3 people was only $41. I gave them $30 in cash and charged $15 on my card with tip. Checked my Amex bill and they apparently charged me $41 on my card as well!! Not to mention they charged me more than what the bill actually should have been!! We added the prices up of everything we ordered and it should have only been $35. Even with taxes, how did our bill become $41??? Plus our 2 friends that came with us had an overcharged bill as well. between 2 people, $106?!! He added their drinks up (i don't remember what it should have been) and it was charged way more that it should have been as well!! AND THEY DON'T EVEN US A COMPUTER SYSTEM TO RING PEOPLE UP!!! IT IS ALL HAND DONE, WHICH I'M PRETTY SURE IS ILLEGAL WHEN IT COMES TO ALCOHOL SALES!!!! My recommendation: IF YOU GO HERE, PAY WITH CASH AFTER EACH ITEM!!!! AND IF YOU DO USE A CREDIT CARD, WATCH YOUR STATEMENT CLOSELY!!!!

data.title: Great comedy, packed in a little tight, good acts
data.text: We had a blast New Years eve. Laughed uncontrollably thru 2 acts. Great booking for the headliner Steve "Mudflap" Mcgrew. Opener not to good but hopefully not the clubs fault. Clean, 2 bars, reasonably priced. And yes 2 DRINK MINIMUM.

data.title: Fun night at Hyena's in Ft. Worth!
data.text: I attended a fun show tonight at Hyena's Comedy Nightclub Fort Worth (a great, great town!). Maria a real pretty Aussie gal, is the MC. She's funny, engaging, and effectively handled a couple of inebriated hecklers with style and class. Mr. Perez, the middle act, has insightful commentary on the plight of the workingman and a great joke about his leg being busier than he! Dustin Ybarra is very funny and thought provoking... my kind of guy. He has that certain something which makes evident why he is on TV and on the silver screen. The club is sparkling clean with great sightlines and a layout which affords close proximity to the performers. The wait staff seems friendly and attentive. Randy Butler has an exciting venue in a "hep" part of town. Take the time this week-end to catch the show!

data.title: Funny
data.text: The club was in the basement of a very interesting building of Fort Worth's It entertainment section in downtown. Although it was crowded, the atmosphere was exciting. Alcohol and soft drinks were available , as well as food. Although it was crowded, the atmosphere was exciting. Alcohol and soft drinks were available for purchase, as well as food. It was an inexpensive evening event.

data.title: The regular comedy club
data.text: Came here to see Scott white. Was a fun night, ended up being pretty pricey with tickets and had to buy 2 drinks each but was fun. We'll over priced for what it is, and the place was packed, so I'm sure they made enough from tickets. All and all the place is cool and comedy was great

data.title: What a great time!!!
data.text: We went here because a friend had some free tickets and i can't believe we have not been before. We went to the 10:30 show and had such a great time, my face is still hurting the next morning from laughing so much. Even if we had to pay it's only $10 and 2 drink minimum per person, the drinks we not over priced at all $5.25 for a Bass Ale that's cheaper than most bars and you don't get this kind of entertainment included. Good prompt service from our server all night. Both of the main comics were super funny, kept the flow nicely, included the crowd (made fun of a bunch of people) and the host was pretty funny as whel (she warmed us up good for the main comics). They have what seems to be recent changed to non smoking in the stage room which was wonderful. There is a bar/lounge just before you go into the stage room where there is smoking and karaoke but we didn't stay for that. We will definitely be returning for what we hope will be another face melting night of laughs.

data.title: Good, funny, and worth the go
data.text:
We went here on New Year's Eve, on free tickets.  When we got there, we "upgraded" to the "preferred seating", which was down on the floor, about 20 feet from the stage.  You are required to purchase two drinks per free ticket, which was reasonable...$7 wine, $4-5 beers...all good.

The comedy was good, a little raw with the first guy, but mellowed out and the main line guy was really funny...would go again!!!

data.title: Had a great time!
data.text: Went to Hyena's with a friend on a Thursday night.  Admission is free with a two drink minimum ($6 per beer).  The most fun you can have for $12 anywhere!  The club is small, the comics were great, including the warm up guys)  I will be back soon!

data.title: fun time
data.text:
Seasoned comedians, large showroom, good service from wait staff, decent drinks and food.  Cover charge $10 or VIP for $15
No reason to pay for the VIP upgrade unless you want to sit up front next to the stage.

data.title: Giggles to Go
data.text:
While in Ft. Worth you might want to reserve a seat at Hyena's Comedy Club. A general admission ticket is about $12.50. There really isn't a bad seat in the club. We all thought Marc Ryan did an excellent job entertaining us. They do have a menu and the waitstaff is most efficient.
Order a beer or a blue drink and a lite munchie. We did the 7:00-8:30 pm show and then went out and enjoyed a few bar pubs in the area. You can't go wrong laughing with your freinds at Hyena's!

data.title: Great Comedians, rip off of a club
data.text: First of all, I called ahead before purchasing tickets to make sure the priority seating area was wheelchair accessible so I knew it shouldn't be an issue travelling with a wheelchair bound friend to have good seats.  We arrived and were whisked right past the short line already forming to get in.  Once in the showroom, they placed us at a table all the way in the back.  I asked the gentleman that took us back why we were being seated in the back as we paid for priority seating.  The man said well, wheelchair guests come here and walked off.  Ticked, I asked the waitress when she came to get our order and she stated it was for safety purposes, the waitresses can't get around the wheelchair easily on the lower floor level.  Infuriated, I went in search of a manager and fortunately was helped by another waitress that said Bull****, and thankfully moved us to her section at the stage.  If that weren't enough, being the only real drinker of the group, I ordered cosmos...might as well have been a virgin as not an inkling of alcohol taste in my drink at $8 each.  Although the comedians were fantastic, Hynea's is an overpriced rip off otherwise...

data.title: Good comedy but that is all.
data.text: Recently they have changed to a non smoking showroom which is AWESOME! Comedy is very funny. Service could be better but maybe she was having a bad night when we were there last week. My hubby and I visit here very often and they have completely changed everything. Still go for the comedy but after the show there is no reason to hang around anymore. They still have a karaoke room and live music stage to enjoy all under one roof however the karaoke SUCKS now! Use to the MC was a guy named Bernard and he was hilarious! Kept the fun going all night. Now there is a boring lady and some guy that acts stoned. They don't want anybody to have too much fun. The live music room is good but there is no dancing. This place has changed for the worse. Use your free tickets then go somewhere else to spend your money after the comedy show.

data.title: A fun night out with friends!
data.text: If you're looking for something fun to do with (aged 21+) friends - this might very well 'fill the bill'!  All the standard stereotypes apply.. two item minimum.. lots of laughs.. if you're sitting up front - you'll probably get picked on by the comic (all in good fun).  The atmosphere is due to improve greatly when they open a smoke-free showroom in late May (2013).  Sign up for a chance of getting free tix while you're there - most people I've spoken to get contacted with a freebie offer (we did).  We'll be back!

data.title: Great Comedy Club
data.text:
Wenbt to  Hyena's Comedy Clud to celebrate a good friend's birthday.  Wonderful club.  The wait staff was average and the view is pretty good from all around.  The comedians were great and the pricing is very reasonable.  While there  sign up to get free tickets.

There is a 2 drink minimum, but the prices for drinks are not any different from other bars/clubs in the area.  Really good lineup as well. Thursday is the "open mic" night and I would like to go back to check that out some time.

Get there about 20 minutes before the show as it gets crowded and it is a first come first seated type arrangement.  Park in the parking garage right behind the club.

data.title: Most FUN!
data.text:
My hubby and I go here about every 6 weeks. So funny! Top line up comedy and make sure to sign up for free tickets on their website. If you go a weekend that they haven't emailed you free tickets just print the buy one get one free ticket on their web page. Get there early cause it's first come first seating in the showroom. Do upgrade to preferred seating cause they sit that line first. Two drink min order per person in the showroom and they add a surcharge so don't feel pressured to tip. Drinks can be as high as $10 each in the showroom. But they have cool names, some light up with neat light things in them and usually strong.
After the comedy show there is karaoke in the karaoke bar. This is a MUST! Bernard (the host) is HILARIOUS!!! You can watch or get up and sing you fave song! The worse you are the better! Everyone is here for a good time! The bar in the karaoke area is great and there is even a shot girl making rounds. Drinks aren't too high ei... $5.50 mixed drinks and $3 shots. Most prices downtown Fort Worth are higher than that. 
This place is a must visit for couples or singles ready for a night out on the town!
